note.p: Education: King's College School, London; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1850), MA (1853), ScD (1884). Lincoln's Inn (admitted 1851)

Career: Mathematical Master, City of London School (1854-1857); ordained deacon (1856); ordained priest (1858); Lecturer in Mathematics, King's College, London (1857); Mathematical Master, Harrow School (1857-1865); co-founder of the Alpine Club (1857); Rector of Berkswell with Barston, Warwickshire (1865-1902); wrote in conjunction with his friend Samuel Hawksley Burbury (FRS 1890) on electricity, magnetism and mathematics
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 pp 266-269 signed by S H B
References: Sir Brian Pippard, FRS, 'Schoolmaster-Fellows and the campaign for science education' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 63-81, plate
